sub_title: R&D | Continuous Innovation | AI | Semantic Web | Linked Data at Data Archiving and Networked Services (DANS)
summary:
Vyacheslav (Slava) Tykhonov is innovator in the IT field and mentor with more than 20 years of experience in the software development, European research infrastructures, Data Science and R&D. Principal Data Scientist working on multiple FAIR research projects simultaneously both on the national and international levels, leveraging those developments with various data services on the global scale, forcing knowledge exchange between involved parties and supporting internal and external innovation activities at the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (DANS-KNAW).

Beside that, Slava is serving as a technical lead, IT architect and advisor for a few ongoing multidisciplinary projects in the different fields. As board member of non-profit organizations CoronaWhy and COVID-19 Museum, he is also participating in the research related to the fight against the coronavirus.

Mission: Bringing innovations to research and education, creation of things that didn't exist before, the development of innovation Pilot Projects, doing experimental stuff in different areas of the knowledge (TRIZ, Theory of Inventive Problem Solving). Widely using Customer Development Methodology with helicopter view, developing problem solving strategies.

Core qualifications:
- Semantic Web and Knowledge organization: Linked Open Data (LOD) Cloud, RDF, Protégé, OpenCalais
- Cloud deployment experience: CI/CD, Docker/Kubernetes, Google Cloud, Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure
- Digital Humanities: Tableau software, iPython notebook, visualization tools (timelines, interactive maps, charts, graphs, treemaps), development of cultural heritage search engines and library catalogues, Data Mining for scientific applications
- Open Source expertise: integrated library systems development, tool for visual thinking and mapping, chart libraries
- websites development: Content Management Systems (Drupal, Wordpress, Joomla, LiveStreet), AJAX, JQuery, Python/Django/Flask
- Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) experience:  SpaCy/scispaCy, Stanford Named Entity Recognizer (NER), MALLET, Ucto, Frog, HeidelTime, TiMBL
- Big Data warehouses: Hadoop, MapReduce on perl (Hadoop::Streaming), MapReduce on Python, HDFS
Digital Marketing Consulting: SEO, SMM, Online PR Measurement, Internet Marketing, Social Media.
- search engines development: Social Media monitoring and News Clipping solutions, information retrieval, machine learning, search engines, relevancy ranking, news clustering
- soft expertise: Media, Public Relations, SEO, SMM

projects.title: EOSC synergy
projects.description:
The goal of EOSC-synergy project is contribution to the European Open Science Cloud landscape by expanding the capabilities and building the capabilities of EOSC. In practice this will mean more compute and storage available to researchers, and more datasets and tools to expand avenues of research. EOSC-synergy receives funding from the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 857647.
My role as Senior Data Scientist is to align requirements coming from all participating EU partners and to contribute to the maturity of Cloud services delivered by EOSC.

contributors.headline: R&D | Continuous Innovation | AI | Semantic Web | Linked Data at Data Archiving and Networked Services (DANS)

projects.title: SSHOC Dataverse
projects.description:
The SSHOC is EU project that's started in January, 2019. Within the project partners from CESSDA, DARIAH, CLARIN and ERIHS work together to create a reliable and production ready Open Source data infrastructure that institutions can install and reuse for their own needs and requirements, based on the Dataverse software. This project was funded by Horizon 2020 call H2020-INFRAEOSC-04-2018, grant agreement # 823782.
I'm leading the technical development of the project and managing people from different EU countries working in the collaboration with Harvard University and other partners.

projects.title: CESSDA DataverseEU 2018
projects.description: DataverseEU will offer a number of services to data repositories and these will be available via the CESSDA Data Catalogue. For aspiring and new CESSDA service providers it will be a possibility to get their own online repository up and running. There will also be a multilingual user interface.

projects.title: Time Machine Supervisor at DANS-KNAW
projects.description:
The Time Machine Project is by far the most ambitious and far-reaching project ever undertaken using Big Data of the Past. Revolutionising the way we experience European history and culture, the project is an international collaboration to build a map of European history that spans thousands of years. Time Machine consortium brings together more than 400+ organisations from 34 countries, including leading academic and research organisations, cultural heritage institutions and private enterprises. They support our key science and technology challenges, provide cultural, historical and geographical material and expertise, and contribute to the development of Time Machine’s structure and services.
I'm supervisor of the project from DANS-KNAW side.

projects.title: Sentiment mining project
projects.description: Development of automated sentiment mining tool (Dutch, English, French and German) to extract opinions of people about specific research topics related to industrialization from various sources like libraries, newspapers and books. This solution allows to convert unstructured text information into structured research datasets.

projects.title: Stakingen in kaart / Mapping strikes
projects.description:
Building visualization of labour conflicts on world map in the historical boundaries from 1927 to 2008: http://laborconflicts.socialhistory.org/worldmap
It shows:
- the number of strikes and lockouts combined
- the number of participants
- the number the working days lost because of these conflicts
An index relates these three indicators to the population number per country. 
Apart from the international data there is visualization of data on a national scale avallable (Netherlands).

profile_positions.description:
Leading technical development of the FAIR Data Platform in Horizon Europe 2020 projects, defining vision, roadmap, fostering innovation and managing technical teams. I have made a significant contribution to the development of the Open Source data platform called Dataverse as a common solution for all EU countries participating in the European Open Science Cloud (EOSC). 

R&D tasks in the national and international projects:
- oversee the technical roadmap and lead multi-disciplinary teams
- doing research leading to high-tech innovations
- taking various roles as expert, data scientist, team lead or lead software engineer
- giving a technical advise and finding solutions for technical problems 
- helping different projects to design and build prototypes and systems for research infrastructures 
- coaching and mentoring people to build bridge between researchers and technical staff
- explaining and translating the most difficult topics to different groups of people to avoid miscommunication 
- collecting requirements from research communities
- implementing and promoting new features, designing new products
profile_positions.title: Senior R&D Engineer

company.name: Institute for Knowledge Organization and Structure, Inc.

profile_positions.company: Institute for Knowledge Organization and Structure, Inc.
profile_positions.description: The Institute for Knowledge Organization and Structure (IKOS) is a private, not-for-profit, scientific research institute. The goal of the institute is to promote and conduct research in the order and structure of knowledge, including empirical, experimental and quasi-experimental research using domain analytical methods. The mission of the IKOS is to discover, document, disseminate and generate implementations of the orders and structures of knowledge.
profile_positions.title: DANS personal member

profile_positions.description:
The Electronic Repository of Russian Historical Statistics is the first research tool of its kind and scope to be created in the Russian Federation. My role (0.2 FTE) is development of ETL (Extract, Load, Transform) processes in order to store qualitative datasets in the structure of relational database and frontend prototyping.

The aim of this research project is to create an on-line electronic repository of Russian historical statistics. The repository operates on the principle of a historical data-hub, bringing together data extracted from various published and unpublished sources in one place. Its principal focus is Russian economic and social history of the last three centuries (18th-21st). All datasets will be visualized in the different way to extract insights and get meaning out of the data stored in the repository.

Participating institutions are:
- Interdisciplinary Centre for Studies in History, Economy and Society (ICSHES)
- International Institute of Social History (Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences), Amsterdam, Netherlands 
- New Economic School, Moscow, Russia (NES)

Website with indicators:
https://ristat.org/datasets/indicators

API service description:
https://github.com/IISH/rusrep/tree/master/service
https://github.com/IISH/rusrep/tree/development

Presentation of the project:
https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/16Lugg-oMe4YAa66MSrDwqrmKhP13h98x-0eMJIWBPec/pub?start=false&loop=false&delayms=3000
profile_positions.title: Software Developer, Technical Lead, R&D

company.name: Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences

profile_positions.company: Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences
profile_positions.description:
The Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (In Dutch: Koninklijke Nederlandse Akademie van Wetenschappen, abbreviated: KNAW) is an organisation dedicated to the advancement of science and literature in the Netherlands. http://knaw.nl

My duty is support of researchers with innovative tools, data mining, collecting, compiling, wrangling and scraping data from various sources, the development of data mining and text mining systems, data visualization and advanced analytics.
profile_positions.title: Software Developer, Architect, Technical Lead

profile_positions.description:
Full Stack Development (Python Pandas, Flask, MongoDB, Redis, D3.js, Node.js & JavaScript) of Clio Infra collaboration platform (version 4) based on the Dataverse data repository developed by Harvard University. The mission of the project is to build the bridge between Data Collections and Research Datasets. “Old school” researchers are be able to transmit all experience and datasets to young researchers from Digital Humanities field that use various computer tools to collect, analyze and combine research datasets they’ve got from older generation of researchers.
Web: https://www.clio-infra.eu
Github: https://github.com/IISH/dpe
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Developer/Architect, Data Scientist, Data Visualization Expert, Technical Lead

profile_positions.description:
The NLGIS-2 (Netherlands Geographic Information System) project is an effort to plot data for these municipalities on historically accurate municipality boundaries for the period 1812 - 1997.

R package should be developed to integrate maps and data in package, write plotting functions (D3 library, Google Maps) and use open standards for data exchange for commercial and scientific purposes. Python package will be intended for professional users interested in historical maps.

Technologies and languages used:
Python (flask, pandas, numpy), Perl, R, MongoDB, Postgresql, GIS, D3 library, data: JSON/XML

Website:
http://nlgis.nl

Geojson/Topojson API:
http://nlgis.nl/api/maps?year=1942

Demo of D3 map visualizations based on nlgis2 AP merged with data from research datasets:
http://nlgis.nl/site?year=1948&code=TXVV

Boundaries changes use case for Utrecht in 1812, 1948 and 1997 (iPython notebook):
http://nbviewer.ipython.org/github/rlzijdeman/nlgis2/blob/master/maps/usecases/viewer.ipynb
Data Analysis use case with pandas and vincent python libraries:
http://nbviewer.ipython.org/github/rlzijdeman/nlgis2/blob/master/maps/usecases/dataapi.ipynb

Github: https://github.com/IISH/nlgis2
Presentation: https://github.com/IISH/nlgis2/blob/master/presentations/dans_20150502/nlgis2_demo_03.pdf
Use case: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rlzijdeman/nlgis2-1/master/graphs/Screenshot_nlgis2_R_hismap01.png
profile_positions.title: Software Developer, Technical Lead, Data Scientist, R&D

profile_positions.description:
The International Institute of Social History (IISH) collects information in the field of social history and makes it available to the public. The IISH is one of the major scientific heritage institutions in the Netherlands. In the field of socio-economic historical research IISH plays a prominent role.

My role (0.4 FTE) was the development of library tools and maintenance of Evergreen open source library system used by library staff as storage system for metadata about books, archives and collections, creating websites and visual tools for Historical Science related projects.
http://www.socialhistory.org
profile_positions.title: Library Systems Software Developer, Collection Development

company.name: TR-HiTiME/ISHER: Visualization of the Strikes in Netherlands

profile_positions.company: TR-HiTiME/ISHER: Visualization of the Strikes in Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
The development of visual interface to discover information about strikes related events and participants, to provide the means for automatically structuring and enriching existing
secondary historical resources which have been manually created by historians, and called Strikes Database. Information automatically acquired from primary historical resources, such as the National Library of the Netherlands (KB) digital archive of historical Dutch newspapers, and linked and associated to primary and secondary historical resources as charts, maps and timelines.

The implementation is based on outcome of the two projects:
NWO/CATCH HiTiME: Historical Timeline Management & Extraction
NWO/Digging Into Data ISHER: Integrated Social History Environment for Research - Digging into Social Unrest

Visualization tools are Open Flash and D3.js (bar and pie charts), Timeline.js (articles timeline), StatPlanet (map of Netherlands and events timeline), Cal-HeatMap (daily calendar).

Demo: http://ristat.sandbox.socialhistoryservices.org/strikes/
Presentation: http://www.slideshare.net/vty/hitimevisualization
profile_positions.title: Data Visualization Expert, Software Developer

profile_positions.description:
HiTIME project funded within the CATCH (Continuous Access to Cultural Heritage) programme of NWO, the Netherlands Organization for Scientific Research.

The goal of HiTiME (0.2 FTE) is the development of a Big Data text analysis system for the recognition and extraction of historical events and facts from a variety of primary and secondary historical sources, such as biographies, brochures, letters and old newspaper articles.
http://www.nwo.nl/en/research-and-results/research-projects/79/2300153679.html

The project consists of two different parts:
1. Searching and matching named entities extracted by HiTIME tool with authorities stored in the library (Linked Data). This part is implemented as Big Data system with Map/Reduce methodology in Hadoop framework with using of Sphinx search engine to match and link gazetteers extracted from other sources. 
2. Making predictions about unknown named entities (Natural Language Processing tools) that can be stored as authorities in the library system. Toolkit is based on Stanford NER and Frog framework for Dutch language.

Public API: http://clearance.sandbox.socialhistoryservices.org/api/
Geo API: http://clearance.sandbox.socialhistoryservices.org/geo/?debug=0&text=Amsterdam+Zuid
Hadoop Map: http://clearance.sandbox.socialhistoryservices.org/examples/hitime_tokens.txt
About HiTIME: http://www.ictonderzoek.net/binaries/content/assets/bestanden/ipn/2014-maart-io-magazine.pdf
profile_positions.title: System Architect, Text Mining, Big Data

profile_positions.description:
CLIO INFRA project (0.4 FTE) is embedded within the European Commission Initiative Digital Research Infrastructure for the Arts and Humanities (DARIAH) and will integrate a number of databases (hubs) consisting of data on global social, economic and institutional indicators over the past five centuries, with special attention for the past 200 years. Scales for every dataset calculated automatically with using functions from R language, different visualizations (charts, maps, timelines) are provided.

Clio Infra Project: http://www.clio-infra.eu
Global Inequality Visualization: http://www.clio-infra.eu/visualize
profile_positions.title: Technical Lead, Research & Development

volunteer_experiences.description: Managing CoronaWhy Labs and building Distributed Common Research and Data Infrastructure and Services for COVID-19 research tracks. https://coronawhy.org

Active contributor in the development of Dataverse, Open Source software platform for FAIR sharing, finding, citing, and preserving research data. It's developed by the Institute for Quantitative Social Science of the Harvard University and the Dataverse community. Coordinator of EU activities as a technical leader of the Dataverse Europe.

The purpose of the Covid-19 Museum is to virtually and openly unite the collections of digital traces linked to the pandemic, to offer the possibility of reproducibly analyzing them and to protect - as a common good - the knowledge that would be extracted from it.
